abstract: Chinese government releases grim report examining effects of global-warming; cites  environmental hazards like rising seas and shifting precipitation patterns; also focuses on political costs as China faces mounting pressure by international community to reduce greenhouse-gas pollution; 900-page study is released just before world leaders meet in Paris to forge international pact on climate change.
lead_paragraph: An assessment from state-appointed experts was released just before negotiations in Paris for a new international agreement to lower greenhouse-gas pollution.

headline.main: Chinese Report on Climate Change Depicts Somber Scenarios
headline.print_headline: China Climate Report Lists Risks of Warming

snippet: An assessment from state-appointed experts was released just before negotiations in Paris for a new international agreement to lower greenhouse-gas pollution.

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject
